meta.purpose: Comprehensive design system documentation for AI-assisted feature development

overview.description: JobsMV is a modern job listing platform with an optimistic, trustworthy design language. This design system provides exact styling specifications and implementation patterns for building consistent features.
designPrinciples: Modern & Clean - Use generous white space and soft rounded corners
Optimistic & Welcoming - Leverage soft accent colors (peach, mint, lilac, blue)
Professional & Trustworthy - Maintain high contrast for readability
Responsive & Accessible - Mobile-first with WCAG AA compliance
keyFeatures: Soft pastel accent backgrounds for cards
Clear visual hierarchy with Orkney display font and Inter body text

forAI: Always use semantic CSS variables (--text-primary, --bg-surface, etc.) instead of hardcoded colors
Prefer pre-defined component classes (.chip, .button-cta, .job-card, etc.) over inline styles
Use Tailwind CSS v4 utilities with CSS variable references
Follow the component anatomy and token specifications exactly
Implement both light and dark theme support by default
Use lucide-react for all icons with consistent sizing

cssVariables.usage: All CSS variables are defined in :root and .dark selectors, accessible via var(--variable-name)

semanticTokens.description: Use these semantic tokens for all color references. They automatically adapt to light/dark themes.

--color-ink.usage: Primary brand color for dark elements, primary buttons

--color-cta.usage: Brand blue for CTAs, focus rings, links

Card.usage: Use for: stat cards, content sections, form containers

JobCard.description: Prominent job listing card with two-section layout: top accent background section and bottom white section. All cards have fixed height for uniformity.

layout.structure: Two-section layout with fixed height (min-height: 320px, height: 100%)
layout.topSection: job-card__top - accent-colored background with rounded top corners, contains header, company, title, logo, and tags
layout.bottomSection: job-card__bottom - white background, contains salary, location, and Details button

topSection.header: job-card__header - flex container with date (job-card__meta) and bookmark button
topSection.metaBar: job-card__meta - displays date with calendar icon
topSection.titleRow: job-card__title-row - flex container with title and logo
topSection.title: job-card__title - job title (24px, bold, display font)
topSection.chipGroup: job-card__chips - flex wrap gap-2 with chip elements

bottomSection.info: job-card__info - flex column container for salary and location
bottomSection.salary: job-card__salary - DollarSignIcon + price text (20px, bold, numeric font)
bottomSection.detailsButton: job-card__details-button - black rounded button with 'Details' text

implementation.fixedHeight: min-height: 320px, height: 100% for uniform card sizes

cssVariablesUsage.description: All color, spacing, and size tokens are defined as CSS variables in globals.css
howToUse: Prefer semantic tokens (--text-primary, --bg-surface) over direct colors
Use Tailwind utilities with CSS variables: bg-[var(--control-fill)]
Font families: Use inline styles: style={{ fontFamily: 'var(--font-display)' }}

componentClasses.description: Pre-defined component classes in globals.css @layer components
componentClasses.usage: Apply these classes directly instead of recreating styles

responsiveDesign.breakpoints: Use Tailwind responsive prefixes: sm:, md:, lg:, xl:, 2xl:

implementation: Add .dark class to <html> or <body> to enable dark theme
No need to use dark: prefix in Tailwind classes
darkMode.testing: Toggle dark mode by adding/removing .dark class

requirements: All interactive elements must have visible focus state (use .focus-ring class)
Maintain WCAG AA contrast ratios (4.5:1 for body text, 3:1 for large text)
Use semantic HTML elements (button, nav, header, main, footer)
Include ARIA labels for icon-only buttons
Use aria-current, aria-pressed, aria-checked where appropriate
accessibility.focusRing: Use .focus-ring utility class which adds 2px solid outline with var(--cta-solid) color

colors: Always use semantic tokens, never hardcode colors
Use accent card backgrounds (peach, mint, lilac, blue) to create visual variety
Maintain high contrast between text and backgrounds
typography: Use var(--font-display) for all headings and titles
Use var(--font-numeric) for prices and statistics
Follow the type scale for consistent hierarchy
spacing: Use Tailwind spacing scale (0-14 defined in design)
Maintain consistent gaps: gap-2 for chips, gap-3 for filters, gap-6 for cards
components: Prefer using pre-defined component classes (.chip, .button-cta, etc.)
Keep component structure consistent with examples
icons: Use consistent sizing: w-4 h-4 for small, w-5 h-5 for medium
Apply text-muted color for decorative icons
